oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Nat Winston recordings - Harvey Gragg's house - 1967-03-23
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recordings of various folk songs recorded by Nat Winston at Harvey Gragg's house on October 15, 1961, April, 14 1963, and March 23, 1967 featuring performers Floyd Gragg, Grandpa Jones, Earl Scruggs, and other unidentified performers according to Nat Winston on recording and Tennessee State Library and Archives.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Floyd Gragg; Earl Scruggs; Grandpa Jones
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Test tones -- Nat Winston sets the scene and talks about how Earl Scruggs is there visiting for Winston's birthday and birth of Nat Winston Jr. -- I'll Fly Away (various) -- various members of the family talk and introduce themselves -- Earl Scruggs talks -- Nat Winston sets the scene -- various members of the family talks and introduces themselves -- Nat Winston sets the scene and talks -- You Rascal, You (Grandpa Jones) -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] -- Mountain Laurel (various) -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] -- You Don't Love Me Like You Used To Do (various) -- Old Rattler (Grandpa Jones) -- Mother Used To Hold Me (various) -- Herd Of Turtles (Grandpa Jones) -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] -- Walking In The Parlor (various)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Scruggs, Earl, 1924-2012; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998;
